infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You are in a kitchen. A normal one.

 Hey, want to see a fridge? Look over there, a fridge![if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The fridge contains [a list of things in the c_0], so there's that.[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You make out [if oven_0 is locked]a locked[else if oven_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] oven nearby.[if oven_0 is open and there is something in the oven_0] The oven contains [a list of things in the oven_0].[end if][if oven_0 is open and the oven_0 contains nothing] The oven is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a table. The table is massive.[if there is something on the s_0] On the table you see [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if] You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast.[if there is something on the s_1] On the counter you can see [a list of things on the s_1].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1] But the thing hasn't got anything on it.[end if] As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a stove. The stove is conventional.[if there is something on the stove_0] On the stove you can see [a list of things on the stove_0], so there's that.[end if][if there is nothing on the stove_0] But the thing is empty.[end if]

There is an exit to the east. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, there is no door. There is an exit to the south.

infos.name: corridor
infos.desc:
This might come as a shock to you, but you've just stumbled into a corridor.



You need an exit without a door? You should try going east. You need an exit without a door? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is not blocked by one.

infos.name: bedroom
infos.desc:
You've just sauntered into a bedroom. You can barely contain your excitement.

 You see a bed. The bed is large.[if there is something on the s_5] On the bed you can see [a list of things on the s_5].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5] But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if]

You need an exit without a door? You should try going east.

infos.name: livingroom
infos.desc:
You are in a livingroom. A normal one. You start to take note of what's in the room.

 You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a sofa. The sofa is comfy.[if there is something on the s_3] On the sofa you can see [a list of things on the s_3]. Something scurries by right in the corner of your eye. Probably nothing.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] But the thing is empty. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the sofa! oh well.[end if]

There is an exit to the west.

infos.name: bathroom
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a bathroom. An ordinary kind of place.

 You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a toilet. The toilet is white.[if there is something on the s_4] On the toilet you can make out [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. Hopefully this doesn't make you too upset.[end if]

There is an exit to the west.

infos.name: pantry
infos.desc:
You arrive in a pantry. An usual one. You begin looking for stuff.

 You can make out a shelf. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a shelf, go to TextWorld. [if there is something on the s_2]You see [a list of things on the s_2] on the shelf.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2]However, the shelf, like an empty shelf, has nothing on it.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is not blocked by one.

infos.name: fridge
infos.desc: The [noun] looks grand. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to bash open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: oven
infos.desc: Useful for roasting things.

infos.name: table
infos.desc: The [noun] is undependable.

infos.desc: The [noun] is undependable.

infos.name: shelf
infos.desc: The [noun] is reliable.

infos.desc: The [noun] is undependable.

infos.desc: The [noun] is shaky.

infos.name: bed
infos.desc: The [noun] is wobbly.

infos.name: stove
infos.desc: Useful for frying things.

infos.name: red hot pepper
infos.desc: You couldn't pay me to eat that [noun].

infos.name: egg
infos.desc: You couldn't pay me to eat that [noun].

infos.desc: That's a [noun]!

infos.name: red tuna
infos.desc: That's a [noun]!

infos.name: yellow potato
infos.desc: You couldn't pay me to eat that [noun].

infos.name: cookbook
infos.desc:
You open the copy of 'Cooking: A Modern Approach (3rd Ed.)' and start reading:

Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  egg
  red hot pepper
  red potato

Directions:
  roast the egg
  chop the red hot pepper
  fry the red hot pepper
  chop the red potato
  roast the red potato
  prepare meal

infos.name: knife
infos.desc: The [noun] looks to fit in here

Directions:

walkthrough: take red hot pepper from counter
cook red hot pepper with stove
chop red hot pepper with knife

objective: You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!
